availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Peelle (Randolph County, Indiana, attorney and secretary of state)

body.p: Randolph County, Indiana, attorney and statesman. North Carolina native. Married to Evaline Boyd Peelle in Richmond County, Indiana, on June 15, 1842. Father of Nathan L. Peelle, Martha L. Peelle, and Narcissa E. Peelle. Teacher in Randolph County in 1842. Attorney in Randolph County, Indiana, in 1850. Attorney in Randolph County in 1860. Secretary of State for the State of Indiana under Governor Oliver P. Morton from 1861 to 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Randolph County, Winchester, p. 92B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Randolph County, White River, p. 856.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Indiana, Wayne County, Center, p. 275A.
”An Event of Note.” _The Richmond Item (Richmond, IN), June 14, 1892.
Indiana Death Certificates, 1900–2011, Indiana State Department of Health and Vital Records, Indiana Archives and Records Administration, Indianapolis, IN, Certificate #139.
_Report of the Secretary of State of the State of Indiana for the Year Ending October 31, 1879 (Indianapolis: Douglas & Carlon, 1879).
